metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological element observation data of baji tan gobi station in the middle reaches of heihe hydrological meteorological observation network from January 1, 2015 to April 13, 2015. The station is located at baji beach, chengxiye city, zhangye city, gansu province, and the underlying surface is gobi.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 100.3042e, 38.9150n and 1562m above sea level.Air temperature and relative humidity sensors are set at 5m and 10m, facing due north;The barometer is installed at 2m;The tilting bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed sensor is set at 5m and 10m, and the wind direction sensor is set at 10m, facing due north;The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 6m, facing due south, and the probe facing vertically downward;The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm of the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water sensor is buried 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil hot plates (3 pieces) are buried 6cm underground.
Observation projects are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m RH_5m Ta_10m, RH_10m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_5m, WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:C), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (in watts/m2), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_60cm, Ms_100cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage), and soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_60cm, Ts_100cm) (unit: Celsius).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: June 10, 2015, 10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.The station will be demolished after April 13.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Liu et al. (2018), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).

该数据集包含了2015年1月1日至2015年4月13日黑河水文气象观测网中游巴吉滩戈壁站气象要素观测数据，站点位于甘肃省张掖市城西巴吉滩，下垫面是戈壁。观测点的经纬度是100.3042E, 38.9150N，海拔1562m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速传感器架设在5m、10m，风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）（单位：摄氏度）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2015-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。该站4月13日后拆除。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

衍生组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性增加，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区是一个人工绿洲，覆盖着玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，与EC系统的测量值相比，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而解决这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅呈现2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，涵盖了2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'eddy covariance system' in the context of hydrometeorological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在水文气象数据收集的背景下，“涡度协方差系统”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of hydrometeorological data collection, an 'eddy covariance system' refers to a measurement technique used to calculate turbulent fluxes, such as energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, by analyzing wind velocity and scalar atmospheric properties. This system is often used to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data for eco-hydrological studies.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在水文气象数据收集的背景下，“涡度协方差系统”指的是一种测量技术，通过分析风速和标量大气特性来计算湍流通量，如能量、水蒸气和碳通量。该系统通常用于获取半小时的湍流通量数据，以便进行生态水文学研究。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the data collection challenges in arid regions with oasis-desert systems compare to those faced in irrigated agricultural areas with strong advective conditions?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠系统中，数据收集面临的挑战与在强对流条件下的灌溉农业区域所面临的挑战相比，有哪些不同之处？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Arid regions with oasis-desert systems face challenges like ecological degradation and data sparsity, requiring extensive instrumentation to capture multi-scale processes. In contrast, irrigated agricultural areas in strong advective conditions encounter difficulties in accurately measuring surface fluxes due to incomplete energy balance closure, requiring refined temperature separation techniques.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠系统面临生态退化和数据稀缺等挑战，需要广泛的仪器设备来捕捉多尺度过程。相比之下，在强烈的平流条件下，灌溉农业区域在准确测量表面通量方面遇到困难，因为能量平衡闭合不完全，这需要精细的温度分离技术。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What does the integration of ground-based measurements with remote sensing data suggest about the evolution of data collection strategies in oasis–desert systems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 地面测量与遥感数据的结合对绿洲-沙漠系统的数据收集策略演变有什么启示？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of diverse data sources, such as ground-based eddy covariance systems and remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and thermal imagers, suggests a trend towards comprehensive, multi-source data collection strategies. This evolution reflects an effort to capture complex eco-hydrological interactions and improve the accuracy of environmental models in oasis–desert systems.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 多种数据源的整合，如地面涡度协方差系统和遥感技术（如激光雷达和热成像仪），表明了一种朝向综合多源数据收集策略的趋势。这一演变反映了捕捉复杂生态水文相互作用的努力，并提高了绿洲-沙漠系统环境模型的准确性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the limited effectiveness of current composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致当前复合温度分离方法在干旱地区效果有限的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions due to errors primarily caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. This results in soil pixels being counted as vegetation pixels, leading to an overestimation of the canopy temperature. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could cause uncertainties in the estimated temperatures.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 当前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性受到限制，主要是由于图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。这导致土壤像素被错误地计入为植被像素，从而导致对冠层温度的高估。此外，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能会导致估计温度的不确定性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in measuring evaporation and transpiration in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，测量蒸发和蒸腾的挑战因素包括哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Factors contributing to the challenges in measuring evaporation and transpiration in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas include the uncertainty in surface–air temperature differences, which are dominant due to errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the composite radiometric temperature. Additionally, the strong advective environment in these regions affects the accuracy of the measurements.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，测量蒸发和蒸腾面临的挑战因素包括表面与空气温度差异的不确定性，这主要是由于从复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被成分温度的误差。此外，这些地区强烈的平流环境也影响了测量的准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of implementing a hierarchical nested scale instrumentation for data collection in oasis-desert systems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中实施分层嵌套尺度仪器进行数据收集的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing a hierarchical nested scale instrumentation allows capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes, providing a comprehensive understanding of oasis-desert interactions. It facilitates the acquisition of diverse datasets through instruments like eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing technologies, which can improve the accuracy and reliability of data concerning energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施分层嵌套尺度的仪器可以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，从而提供对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的全面理解。它通过涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和遥感技术等仪器促进了多样化数据集的获取，这可以提高有关能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据的准确性和可靠性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of utilizing multiscale and multidisciplinary data from experiments like HiWATER for understanding eco-hydrological processes over heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 利用像HiWATER这样的实验中多尺度和多学科数据来理解异质表面的生态水文过程有什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing multiscale and multidisciplinary data from experiments like HiWATER can significantly advance the understanding of eco-hydrological processes, as it overcomes the limitations posed by the lack of multiscale observations. This comprehensive data collection approach enables better analysis of interactions between different landscape components, leading to improved models and strategies for managing water resources and ecological balance in arid regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用像HiWATER这样的实验所获得的多尺度和多学科数据，可以显著提升对生态水文过程的理解，因为它克服了缺乏多尺度观测所带来的局限性。这种综合数据收集方法能够更好地分析不同景观组成部分之间的相互作用，从而改善模型和策略，以管理干旱地区的水资源和生态平衡。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind developing a multiscale dataset in oasis-desert areas using instruments arranged in hierarchically nested scales?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区开发多尺度数据集的目标是什么，使用按层次嵌套尺度排列的仪器？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces by obtaining multiscale and multidisciplinary data. This is achieved through the HiWATER experiment, which utilizes instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes and understand oasis-desert interactions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是通过获取多尺度和多学科的数据来解决在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的挑战。这是通过HiWATER实验实现的，该实验利用分层嵌套尺度的仪器来捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，并理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，维持对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are crucial to understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. This understanding supports the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis, aids in achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, and helps protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征至关重要。这种理解支持了绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展，有助于实现碳达峰和碳中和，并有助于保护绿洲的生态稳定和社会经济发展。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies enable the effective collection and quality control of hydrometeorological data in harsh desert environments?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法能够有效收集和质量控制恶劣沙漠环境中的水文气象数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Several methodologies contribute to the effective collection and quality control of hydrometeorological data in harsh desert environments, including the use of automatic weather stations with sensors for various parameters, such as air temperature, humidity, wind speed, radiation, and soil moisture. Data are collected at frequent intervals (e.g., every 10 minutes) and undergo a rigorous quality control process that includes sensor calibration, data processing, and dataset generation.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 多种方法论有助于在恶劣的沙漠环境中有效收集和质量控制水文气象数据，包括使用自动气象站配备各种参数的传感器，如气温、湿度、风速、辐射和土壤湿度。数据以频繁的时间间隔（例如每10分钟）收集，并经过严格的质量控制过程，包括传感器校准、数据处理和数据集生成。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do multiscale observation techniques enhance the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测技术如何增强对异质景观中生态水文过程的理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Multiscale observation techniques, such as those employed in the HiWATER experiment, enhance understanding by providing data from hierarchically nested scales. This includes a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing missions. These techniques capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes and interactions, helping to address challenges of data availability across different spatial scales.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测技术，如在HiWATER实验中采用的技术，通过提供来自层次嵌套尺度的数据来增强理解。这包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感任务的通量观测矩阵。这些技术捕捉多尺度生态水文过程和相互作用，帮助解决不同空间尺度上数据可用性的问题。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might ground-based measurement data be applied to partition evapotranspiration (ET) into evaporation (E) and transpiration (T) using the Craig–Gordon model?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么地面测量数据可以用于根据Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The ground-based measurement data are applied to partition ET into E and T to achieve better validation using a combination of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques and eddy covariance (EC) measurements, which helps in accurately estimating E and T under different vegetation types and environmental conditions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 地面测量数据被用于将蒸发蒸腾（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T），以便通过结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度协方差（EC）测量来实现更好的验证，这有助于在不同植被类型和环境条件下准确估计E和T。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it challenging to achieve accurate soil and vegetation component temperature calculations for the separation of E and T in a two-source energy balance (TSEB) model?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型中，实现准确的土壤和植被组分温度计算以分离蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）具有挑战性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Accurate soil and vegetation component temperature calculations are challenging due to errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from surface composite radiometric temperature, image classification errors, and uncertainties in atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, which affect the TSEB model's performance in estimating E and T.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 准确的土壤和植被成分温度计算具有挑战性，因为从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被成分温度时存在误差，图像分类错误，以及大气上行辐射和透射率的不确定性，这些因素影响了TSEB模型在估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）方面的性能。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you evaluate the effectiveness of current data quality control measures in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of hydrometeorological datasets collected in arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估当前数据质量控制措施在确保干旱地区收集的水文气象数据集的准确性和可靠性方面的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data quality control measures in place for hydrometeorological datasets in arid regions include ensuring data completeness, removing duplicate records, eliminating data beyond physical significance or instrument range, marking questionable data, and standardizing date and time formats. These measures help ensure accuracy and reliability, but challenges like multiscale observation availability and classification errors in image data highlight the need for continuous evaluation and improvement.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，水文气象数据集的数据质量控制措施包括确保数据的完整性、去除重复记录、消除超出物理意义或仪器范围的数据、标记可疑数据以及标准化日期和时间格式。这些措施有助于确保数据的准确性和可靠性，但多尺度观测的可用性和图像数据中的分类错误等挑战突显了持续评估和改进的必要性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't understand how data collection methods ensure the accuracy and reliability of hydrometeorological observations in arid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解数据收集方法如何确保干旱地区水文气象观测的准确性和可靠性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data collection methods involve a comprehensive quality control process, including sensor calibration, data processing, and dataset generation. Observational data are carefully quality controlled throughout these stages to ensure accuracy and reliability, as seen in the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) system.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法涉及全面的质量控制过程，包括传感器校准、数据处理和数据集生成。观察数据在这些阶段中都经过仔细的质量控制，以确保准确性和可靠性，这在黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）系统中得到了体现。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm not sure about the techniques used to address the challenges of multiscale observations in heterogeneous landscape studies.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定在异质景观研究中解决多尺度观测挑战所使用的技术。
Assertion.AnswerEn: To address these challenges, the HiWATER experiment employs instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales and conducts intensive observation periods (IOPs) with a sparse network setup to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes over different landscapes, such as oasis-desert systems.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 为了解决这些挑战，HiWATER实验采用分层嵌套尺度的仪器，并通过稀疏网络设置进行密集观测期（IOPs），以捕捉不同景观（如绿洲-沙漠系统）上的多尺度生态水文过程。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don’t understand how datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange are compiled and made available for research in oasis–desert areas.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白与绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换相关的数据集是如何编制和提供给研究的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets are compiled from long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, supplemented by hydrometeorological and vegetation data. These datasets are processed, quality-controlled, and made freely available through platforms like the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据集是通过对能量、水蒸气和碳通量的长期观测编制而成，辅以水文气象和植被数据。这些数据集经过处理、质量控制，并通过国家西藏高原数据中心等平台免费提供。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore various data collection methods used to monitor hydrometeorological variables in arid regions and how these methods address the challenges of data scarcity.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨用于监测干旱地区水文气象变量的各种数据收集方法，以及这些方法如何应对数据稀缺的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: In arid regions, data collection methods for monitoring hydrometeorological variables include using eddy covariance systems, automatic meteorological stations, and various remote sensing tools such as LiDAR and imaging spectrometers. These methods aim to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes, particularly challenging due to the poor availability of multiscale observations. Instrumentation is often arranged in hierarchically nested scales to address these challenges, as seen in both oasis and desert environments.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，监测水文气象变量的数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统、自动气象站以及各种遥感工具，如激光雷达和成像光谱仪。这些方法旨在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，特别是由于多尺度观测的稀缺而面临的挑战。仪器通常以分层嵌套的尺度进行布置，以应对这些挑战，这在绿洲和沙漠环境中均有体现。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential datasets that could be used to study energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems and discuss their availability and quality control measures.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨可以用于研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的潜在数据集，并讨论它们的可用性和质量控制措施。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets for studying energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems include those from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) and datasets from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center. These datasets consist of long-term observations of fluxes, hydrometeorological data, and vegetation and soil parameters. They are subjected to quality control measures such as sensor calibration and data processing, ensuring reliability for research purposes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的潜在数据集包括来自黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）和国家西藏高原数据中心的数据集。这些数据集包含了长期的通量、气象水文数据以及植被和土壤参数的观测。它们经过质量控制措施，如传感器校准和数据处理，确保了研究的可靠性。
